Utterance: Hi there! Welcome back. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been doing well, actually. I cooked a couple of healthy meals like we talked about!
That’s fantastic! How did it feel to get back into cooking?
It felt great! I made a stir-fry and a salad, and I enjoyed both. I forgot how much I like cooking.
That’s wonderful to hear! It sounds like you’re finding joy in preparing your meals. Have you noticed any changes in how you feel physically or emotionally since you started cooking more?
I think I feel more energized. Eating healthier has definitely helped my mood.
Classified_Subsection: Physiological Observations: History of Present Illness (HPI)

Utterance: That’s excellent! It seems like you’re really taking control of your health. How has your sleep been with these changes?
My sleep has been good! I’m still reading before bed, and I think that helps too.
It sounds like you’re establishing a healthy routine. Have there been any challenges in maintaining these habits?
Not really. I’m trying to stay consistent, but sometimes I still feel the urge to eat out when I’m busy.
That’s understandable. It’s all about balance. Would it be helpful to plan for those busier days in advance?
Yes, if I could prepare meals ahead of time, that would definitely help.
Great idea! Let’s set a goal for meal prepping this week. You could make a few extra portions to have on hand for when you’re busy.
I can do that! I’ll try to set aside some time this weekend for meal prep.
Perfect! I’m excited to hear how that goes. Now, let’s revisit the topic of your acting career. Have you had any auditions or opportunities since we last spoke?
I actually had a couple of auditions! They went okay, but I didn’t get a callback for either.
It’s good that you’re putting yourself out there. How did you feel after those auditions?
I felt a bit disappointed, but I tried to remind myself that it’s part of the process.
That’s a healthy perspective! Remember, rejection is common in the acting industry. How do you typically cope with that disappointment?
I try to talk to friends who understand what I’m going through. It helps to share my feelings.
That’s a great strategy. Building a support network can really help during tough times. Are there any other coping strategies you’ve found effective?
Sometimes I just take a break and do something else I enjoy, like going for a walk or listening to music.
Those sound like excellent ways to reset. Have you had a chance to incorporate those activities more into your routine?
Yes, I’ve been walking more often, especially when I feel overwhelmed. It helps clear my mind.
That’s wonderful! It seems like you’re developing a toolkit for managing stress. Are there any new goals you’d like to set for yourself in terms of your acting or personal life?
I’d like to focus on building my confidence for auditions. Maybe I could find a class or workshop to help with that.
That sounds like a fantastic goal! Taking a class could provide valuable skills and boost your confidence. Would you like to research some options this week?
Yes, I’ll look into that. I think it would really help.
Great! I’m excited to hear about what you find. Before we wrap up, is there anything else you’d like to discuss or any concerns you want to address?
No, I think we covered everything. Thank you for the support, Ellie!
You’re very welcome! I’m proud of the progress you’re making. I look forward to our next session. Take care!
You too, goodbye!
Goodbye!
